file_content.text: Rasmus Blys is distracted by the Republic. Now is our time to seize CZ-198.
Czerka has a bright future with the Empire.
At attention, men! Welcome back the heroes who just won CZ-198 for the Empire!
Czerka thanks you as well. I've begun downloading the data from CZ-198. Even the details concerning the Vigilant.
Czerka's security system was a living abomination. Once activated, it turned the entire facility against us.
The Vigilant was monstrous.
Yes, horrible. But the biogenetic implications are amazing. My researchers will have a field day with the Vigilant.
Czerka workers were still down there, trapped by Rasmus and forced to work.
What about your employees?
I can see the lawsuits now. Drones are never grateful.
Czerka can thank me all it wants. What about you?
[Flirt] Show some emotion.
Thank you. I mean it.
Captain, enter firing range of CZ-198.
While you were busy, my top Czerka engineers augmented this dreadnaught's weaponry. We've increased its firepower tenfold.
Target within range.
I've pulled every last file from CZ-198. The personnel are expendable, as is the facility. We can't leave them behind for the Republic to use against us.
This ship's Czerka-modified weapons will obliterate CZ-198. Simply give the order.
Prepare to strike the Czerka moon. Fire on my mark.
Do it. [Destroy CZ-198]
Fire.
From the ashes, a new Czerka is born. In another life, you would've made an excellent senior executive.
There are people down there. Czerka may tolerate their sacrifice, but I won't.
Abort the attack.
Moff Kresk--deploy attack squadrons to guard the moon. Destroy any Republic vessels that attempt to land.
Right away.
Curious solution. Inefficient, but not entirely without merit.
Czerka now has a future within the Empire. And though our armaments are strong, nothing will replace you as the Empire's greatest weapon.
I've given you the seeds to build a strong industry within the Empire. Do not disappoint me.
I expect results from Czerka.
Czerka never disappoints.
Czerka's at its best when tinkering with nature. Work without fear of judgment. Create something that makes the Vigilant look like an astromech droid.
Don't let ethics inhibit you.
An inspiring vision, my lord. One I can get behind.
Remember that praise while you consider my fee.
On that note, pay me.
I've never been more satisfied by an external contractor. May we do business again.
We own you. Open your factories, continue your innovations, but never place greed before your Empire.
Remember who you serve.
You won't have any trouble out of me.
Now that you have CZ-198's complete research data, what are your plans for Czerka's future?
What's next for Czerka?
The Republic's defiled our name. Perhaps we'll re-brand. But we'll never abandon Czerka's signature dedication to quality.
You have work to do. I have a war to win.
Our business here is done.
I won't keep you any longer. Pleasure doing business with you.
You've been working hard. Long hours, the stress of an entire company on your shoulders. Maybe I can help you unwind a little.
[Flirt] Let's celebrate, Eva.
That... actually sounds lovely. I think I have a bottle of something in my shuttle....
If I'd known the Empire was this hospitable, I'd have defected ages ago.
Now please excuse me. The Grand Moff wants Czerka weapons on the front within the week. Pleasure doing business with you.
Thank you again. While the Republic bullies their allies, you're forging new bonds. That's how the Empire will win this war.
Good luck on the battlefield. Fight for the new Czerka, and a renewed Empire!
Good luck. We'll pick you up over CZ-198 once the facility's neutralized.
Observe the Czerka R-6000 blaster rifle: cutting-edge design, state-of-the-art recoil dampeners, unrivaled stopping power.
Beautiful! I'll take sixty thousand. Czerka rifles for all!
Droids are no substitute for a live Sith target. Shoot me, and we'll see if your weapon holds up.
Try it on me. [Deflect bolt]
Do it.
Good show! My order stands. For you, Wrath, my awe only increases.
I am Moff Kresk. The enchanting gunner is Eva Kaayz, chief operations officer of Czerka's Weapons Division.
Let me see that. [Force Grab]
A toy. No match for the dark side. But perhaps capable of slaying Jedi.
We still have some kinks to work out, my lord.
Your reputation precedes you. I am Moff Kresk. You've already met Eva Kaayz, chief operations officer of Czerka's Weapons Division.
Never trust a sales demo. Give it here. I'll tell you if the weapon's worth your credits.
Not so fast. [Test fire]
Not bad.
Flashy weapons don't win wars. I'll judge whether it's worthy of our military.
Let me try it. [Test fire]
Good work.
Glad you approve. Eva Kaayz, chief operations officer, Czerka Weapons Division.
You handle that blaster well, miss...?
[Flirt] Good shot.
Eva Kaayz. Chief operations officer, Czerka Weapons Division.
And I'm Moff Kresk. Sorry to keep you waiting. We've called you here on dire business.
Good, another woman who can handle herself. Careful, though--we don't want to emasculate the Moff.
[Flirt] Impressive shot.
I'm sure he won't mind.
Ladies, please! Let's keep this professional.
Since when does the Empire conduct business with green-skinned hucksters?
You'd trust an alien?
Imperial-alien synergy is the way of the future.
Quite right. A new era and all. Sorry to keep you waiting.
I hope you didn't summon us for a sales pitch, Moff.
Don't keep us waiting.
How rude of me.
Moff Kresk, at your service. The enchanting gunner is Eva Kaayz, chief operations officer of Czerka's Weapons Division.
We've called you here on dire business, I'm afraid.
Czerka has been seized by the Republic. They're freezing assets, replacing senior management. "Corporate restructuring," they call it--but I know nationalization when I hear it!
This sudden shift in tactics reeks of fear. The Republic will stop at nothing to win this war.
The Republic grows desperate.
Lucky for us, they're making rookie mistakes.
For centuries, the Jedi have trapped the Republic in a cage of morality. At last, they're beginning to free themselves.
Finally the Republic learns.
Quite right, my lord. Fortunately, they're still making amateur mistakes.
Czerka weapons are hot on the black market. Once the supply dries up, prices will skyrocket.
The underworld won't be happy.
Angering the underworld. Not the first error the Republic's made today.
The Republic's expansion outpaces its resources. They're locking down Czerka as their exclusive supplier.
A wise move in wartime.
A bold stunt, certainly. But their execution was lacking.
What exactly does Czerka do?
Remind me about Czerka.
You're serious? Blasted marketing department.... Czerka Corporation is the galaxy's premiere droid and weapons manufacturer.
Now they belong exclusively to the Republic. But not for long....
Why do you waste my time, Moff? Czerka can rot as far as I'm concerned.
I couldn't care less.
Czerka's weapons are top notch. With exclusive ownership, the Republic will annihilate our armies. They'll win the war!
But you haven't lost yet....
Czerka owns a private moon facility: CZ-198. Home to our most splendid, revolutionary and experimental technology.
When the takeover began, CZ-198 entered lockdown. The Republic attempts negotiations. But you could take the facility by force and win Czerka's secrets for the Empire.
While the Republic talks, we'll steal Czerka's projects from under their noses.
CZ-198 will be ours.
Glad you're on board. But first, there's the matter of former management.
If we take CZ-198, Czerka will belong to the Empire as much as the Republic. Your company will never be independent again.
Why bring this to the Empire?
The Republic will ruin Czerka's profit margins. Red tape will strangle my pet projects. I've negotiated a better deal with the Empire.
The deal's forfeit without CZ-198. And its current management is loathe to surrender.
The Republic wouldn't enter a stalemate over some locked warehouse.
What's the catch?
We've identified two obstacles to the seizure of CZ-198.
Special Executive Rasmus Blys, CZ-198's overseer. Backstabber, kiss-off and one of Corporate Quarterly's "Top 500 Managers to Watch."
That conniving twerp initiated the lockdown of CZ-198. If we attack, he's threatened to unleash a prototype security system, code-named "Vigilant."
This is why we've summoned you. To retire Rasmus Blys, disable his Vigilant security network and secure the secrets of CZ-198 for the Empire.
Nothing will stop our claim to Czerka's facility. Not a territorial exec, and certainly not his security system.
Consider it done.
Fantastic. It's time to move.
How much are these Czerka secrets worth to you?
If the pay's right, I'm in.
Out-of-pocket expenses are your own. But Czerka's matching the Empire's payout on this job.
Any insight into this prototype security system?
What is the Vigilant?
I've never heard of it before today. But if Rasmus was involved, the Vigilant will be extremely dangerous.
Stay here with Moff Kresk. I'll get everything you need from CZ-198 to start over in the Empire.
[Flirt] I'll do it for Eva.
That's very kind of you.
Take my company shuttle. It's executive-exclusive, so please fly smoothly. Clearance codes are in the nav computer.
The Empire can't afford to lose CZ-198. Good luck.
Isn't she something?
